item.title: Contact Me
item.description: You can reach me through: Personal Email: arseniy.kouzmenkov@gmail.com School Email: kouzmenk@ualberta.ca Linked In: https://www.linkedin.com/in/arseniykd/

item.title: Projects & Competitions
item.description: Projects Vitabu: This was our CMPUT 301 project. Vitabu is an Android app that provides users with the possibility to lend and borrow books from other users. This project was done in a group of 6 people. The project was built using Firebase. You can view this project here. Arduino Air Hockey: This was our CMPUT 274 final group project. We made an air hockey game in C++ for the Arduino platform with a realistic physics engine.

item.title: Professional Experience
item.description: Arista Networks Software Engineering Intern, May 2019 - Present. Vancouver, BC During my time at Arista Networks, I worked in the Routing Team in a highly agile environment. Some of my tasks included the following: I designed and developed a framework in C++ to add generic counters to event occurrences, improving information available when debugging Adapted old CLI command output method to work asynchronously in C++, fixing a hard to reproduce bug and improving platform stability at scale.

item.title: Education
item.description: B.Sc. Computing Science Honors - University of Alberta (September 2017 - December 2020) Scholarships & Awards: International Student Scholarship (2017 - Present) International Advanced Placement Scholarship (2017) International Country Scholarship (2017) University of Alberta Undergraduate Scholarship (2018) Dean’s Honor Roll (2018, 2019) Completed Coursework Introduction to Tangible Computing I & II: The Honors introduction to Computing Science done in C++ and Python. Development done on the Arduino platform to develop good intuition about necessity of efficient algorithms and proper memory management.

item.title: About Me
item.description: Hello! You have gotten to this page for a reason, and that reason is to learn more about me, so here goes: I am Arseniy Kouzmenkov, a third year Computing Science Honors student at the University of Alberta. For developing, I prefer to use C++ and C for larger projects, Java for Android development and Python for small scripts. I really enjoy system development and working with low level networking.
